column4: you're on a subnet, configure your router to forward the port to that box
I did, just like i did for port 80, 21, etc. they all work except 3784
any iptables blocking it? sudo tail -f /var/log/auth.log and watch for any errors
I just checked if my server is 'up' from ventrilo.com, it says it's fine, but i still can't connect to it
does netstat -tunap from terminal show that port as listening/open?
MSG: Contacting server. and stays there
can we go to PM and I'll tell you the info, maybe you can understand better that way?
your logs should show the error, i'm not familiar with ventrilo
the tail -f etc. stuff you told me didn't show anything
what i don't understand is that, I can login to it locally, I can telnet to it from outside, even ventrilo.com can know the status of my server, yet for some weird reason, outside people can't get in
tail -f reads in real time, watch it as you invoke the error
the error is not being outputted on server side, it's like messages aren't even reaching it
you don't seem to be getting an error, just no connection, is ventrilo configured right?
it worked out of nowhere just now, i didn't even change anything
well. sweet. probably a constipated port ;p
